####################################
# Cluster Configuration File
# author: steven@vargaconsultin.ca 2019, feb Toronto, On
[default]
aws_access_key_id = AKIAINY2DK5XC6IDZBZA
aws_secret_access_key = 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
region = us-east-1

[cluster default]
SIZE = 1
AMI = ami-028e2ef487c73cde0 
IP    = 52.2.17.127
INSTANCE_TYPE = c3.large
AVAILABILITY_ZONE = us-east-1a
EBS_VOLUMES = vol-0f10ba208113d6c69,vol-0e0f99fdbecad7fd3,vol-0db7e54bb424137a2
UDP_PORTS = 1001-3000,22
TCP_PORTS = 22,80
BID = 0.1
SPOT_REQUEST_SIZE = 20
IO_SERVER_PER_NODE = 1
# python pattern; don't forget to escape '%'
HOSTNAME_PATTERN = node%%02i

# named cluster template, either to execute or used 
# for bash completion 
[cluster small]
SIZE = 3
IO_SERVER_PER_NODE = 3

[cluster medium]
SIZE = 20

[cluster example_002]
SIZE = 4
AMI   = 
IP    = 52.2.17.127
INSTANCE_TYPE =   i3.16xlarge
AVAILABILITY_ZONE = us-east-1a
EBS_VOLUMES =
TCP_PORTS = 22
BID = 0.11



# this section is

to help bash completion, the controller doesn't check against this database
# only to help the user in selection. 
[completion]
instances = c3.large, c3.large, c3.xlarge, c3.2xlarge, c3.4xlarge, c3.8xlarge, c5d.large, c5d.large, c5d.xlarge, c5d.2xlarge, c5d.4xlarge, c5d.9xlarge, c5d.18xlarge
images =
regions = us-east-1, us-east-2, us-west-1, us-west-2, ca-central-1, eu-central-1, eu-west-1, eu-west-2, eu-west-3, eu-north-1, ap-northeast-1, ap-northeast-2, ap-northeast-3, ap-southeast-1, ap-southeast-2, ap-south-1, sa-east-1

usage: cluster [-h] {start,add,reconfigure,list,terminate,ssh} ...

cluster builder for AWS EC2 with built in bash completion. For authentication
please see/update ~/.ec2config or ~/.aws/config. An example configuration is
provided with this distribution.

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit

commands:
  way to control your AWS EC2 cluster

  {start,add,reconfigure,list,terminate,ssh}
                        additional help
    start               create/start cluster with given properties
    add                 add nodes to existing cluster
    reconfigure         re-initializes nodes of a cluster
    list                AWS EC2 status information
    terminate           terminate cluster and free ec2 resources

ssh                 execute commands/scripts on all hosts

Copyright © <2019> Varga Consulting, Toronto, ON info@vargaconsulting.ca

usage: cluster start [-h] [--zone ZONE] [--ami AMI]
                     [--ebs-volumes VOL_ID [, ...]] [--instance TYPE]
                     [--bid-price PRICE] [--size N] [--name NAME]
                     [--tcp-ports PORT [, ...]] [--udp-ports PORT [, ...]]
                     [--ip ADDRESS] [--spot-request-size INT]
                     [--io-servers INT] [--hostname-pattern NAME%%02i]

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --zone ZONE           aws ec2 availability zone, must be within `region`
  --ami AMI             EC2 image id
  --ebs-volumes VOL_ID [, ...]
                        optional comma separated volume ids
  --instance TYPE       cluster instance
  --bid-price PRICE     maximum bidding price in USD
  --size N              number of instances including master node
  --name NAME           unique name/tag of the cluster to track state
  --tcp-ports PORT [, ...]
                        list of external IP ports, SSH required
  --udp-

ports PORT [, ...]
                        optional list of UDP ports
  --ip ADDRESS          elastic IP for master node
  --spot-request-size INT
                        spot requests broken into `size` blocks
  --io-servers INT      number of io servers per node
  --hostname-pattern NAME%%02i
                        python pattern to name nodes

usage: cluster add [-h] --name NAME [--ami AMI] [--size N] [--instance TYPE]
                   [--bid-price PRICE] [--spot_request-size INT]
                   [--io-servers INT]

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --name NAME           name/tag of the cluster that was provided when
                        starting cluster
  --ami AMI             EC2 image id
  --size N              number of nodes instantiated
  --instance TYPE       cluster instance (default: c3.large)
  --bid-price PRICE     maximum bidding price in USD
  --spot_request-size INT
                        spot requests broken into blocks
  --io-servers INT      number of io servers per node

add          -h           --help       list         reconfigure  ssh          start        terminate
